aR78wzlLx7J0I6QvZtkEEg.text: Amazing cupcakes, best part of the sweet treats we enjoyed while in Pittsburgh for the weekend.  Totally worth the trip to the South side for the afternoon.

ku33sUGJhZnAIT6-eboy2w.text: Delivery was horrific experience. I arranged 1 week in advance to send cupcakes to my daughter at Duquesne. Amanda told me that my daughter would be texted to come to the reception area of dorm to pick up a birthday treat on her birthday. Instead, she received a phone call the DAY AFTER her birthday to meet a guy in a white car in front of a different dorm on campus. She was alarmed and embarrassed but left class with a male classmate to escort her to the stranger's car. Not at all the lovely surprise I anticipated for my girl her first month of college!!!!

29X9VTHnoO0aLTDVTHFNsg.text: I've never written a review anywhere, but this cafe is so good I had to. They serve pastries, breakfast, lunch, and (if you're familiar with Pittsburgh coffee) la prima espresso coffe which is to die for. Everything is made on sight, and absolutely delicious. Also, as a broke college student, this cafe is quite reasonably priced. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and the atmosphere is very quaint. The croissants are some of the best in Pittsburgh. Deffinitely my new favorite cafe!

DwdfD0kL5vAzOD2392-Evg.text: Amanda has been an absolute joy to work with! Her attention to detail and level of professionalism are unmatched. She held a private tasting for me and my fiance and we were blown away with her level of skill and talent! Best baker in the Burgh hands down!

9zzo7frSWmVzdzV2MIt3Sw.text: Holy cow these are some killer cupcakes! We just randomly stopped in on a Saturday afternoon to see what they had and were blown away! They are open till 10pm on the weekends! How fantastic is this! For years I've been saying there needs to be a late night bakery cause sometimes you just need a cupcake after a long night! I digress. We orders the salted caramel, the peanut butter chocolate (I forget the cute name), and the chocolate covered strawberry. I was able to talk people into splitting the caramel and strawberry with me so I could try them both and thank god! The chocolate covered strawberry was delish, just a tich sweet for me but still fantastic. The cake was rich and fluffy an the buttercream was smooth and flavorful. Not to mention it was loaded with yummy strawberry filling! The salted caramel was heaven. Seriously heaven. The caramel filling, the chocolate cake, and the caramel buttercream with caramel drizzle, and then those little bits of Black Sea salt! Oh lord they were fantastic. I'm sad that I didn't get to try the chocolate peanut butter, but I did snack a milk chocolate salted caramel candy for the ride home and it was divine! The caramel was smooth and creamy, absolutely fantastic. I just wish they were so much closer to home but I'm sure my waist line is thankful for the distance!

5Enuyd4y7viCGl2eVyUb7g.text: Delicious!  Would be a winner on Cupcake Wars.  The chocolate cupcake filled with salted caramel was absolutely wonderful.  Wish we lived closer and we would be in often.

M4OzeZsCoIgPqQv_rAQ8uA.text: Absolutely fantastic!! A friend and I were out galavanting around the city one Saturday morning and were craving something sweet.  This was the perfect stop!  Amanda's shop is adorable and her chocolate selection was equally impressive.  We each got a cupcake and two chocolates.  While the cupcake (chocolate salted caramel) was quite possibly the best salted caramel I've ever had in a cupcake I was blown away by the chocolates.  If you're ever in the area or in search of a good chocolate bite, I highly suggest the orange truffel as well as the ginger/cardamom.  I can't wait to go back!  I LOVE to see local shops do well in Pittsburgh.  Go here for your next sweet treat!

PPyRCSLDx3ZOXlgAtda8Ew.text: Seriously the best cupcakes in Pittsburgh! But that is not all... Amanda, the owner, also makes amazing cookies and breakfast pastries! AND HOMEMADE CHOCOLATE! She also serves La Prima coffee! You can tell that the products used are high quality and Amanda shows an attention to detail that is just astounding. She does custom orders, so call ahead!

W3J7zZt0Eq8ADqn6Al9yvg.text: I came here for a Yelp Meet the Business Owner event yesterday.  I was really impressed with the quality of the chocolates and cupcakes that Amanda, the owner, makes.  I sampled one of the orange flavored chocolates, and it was delicious, esp. with some champagne.  I also sampled one of the mini-cupcakes, and filled and decorated my own large cupcake.  Amanda makes all of the cupcakes, fillings, frostings, etc. herself, and they were all delectable, not to mention adorable (though her decorated cupcakes are prettier than mine!).  Finally, I tried some chocolate fondue with fruit and pretzel dippers, and it was absolutely delicious.  Amanda was also kind enough to make some fresh-squeezed raspberry and mango lemonade for us, which she also sells as a refreshing treat.  She mentioned that she is in the process of acquiring an espresso machine and developing a pastry menu, so it looks like she will have some breakfast and tea-oriented products soon.  Although Amanda's products are more expensive than those of some other places in town, it's very clear from their appearance and taste that they are very high quality.  I was extremely impressed by all of the creative ideas Amanda had for her products.  The cupcakes and chocolates would make perfect favors for a wedding or baby shower, not to mention excellent Valentine's Day gifts.  Additionally, having a cupcake decorating party or chocolate fondue would be a great idea for a little girl's birthday party or a bachelorette party, and it was a lot of fun when I tried it!  I was also impressed to hear that Amanda gives back to the community by giving away her older cupcakes for homeless children's birthday parties.  It's very clear that this business is a labor of love, and that Amanda takes great pride in it, so support her by trying some of her wonderful confections!

kMxraDhTKfzCtqLWm3774g.text: I've tried several of the cupcakes which I can't stop myself from inhaling as soon as I get home.  I had the chocolate with a gorgeous pink icing and filled with a jam which was cherry?  Not sure- but the jam was a lovely surprise.  Love, love cupcakes with a surprise in the center.  I've also tried the lavender icing-delicious as well as any cupcake drizzled with caramel-amazing how a drizzle can have so much taste impact on the ol' taste buds.  I tell everyone how good these are.  The latter 2 I mentioned were not chocolate-I always eat a chocolate base and yet these were supernal.  A dream.  And on Saturdays, you want to get there early because those little gems disappear rather quickly.   So why 4 stars instead of 5?  Only because they aren't huge (which is good for the waistline and that's what I tell myself every time I feel any residual guilt.)  And they're a touch more expensive than I'm accustomed to in NYC.  I had a favorite cupcake shop in NYC that just closed overnight even though we all thought it was a successful enterprise (perhaps lesson learned there).  But whatever.  If you're a cupcake aficionado and you've been to Manhattan you know Magnolia supposedly has the best--well, they pale in comparison to these.  They can't hold a candle next to Le Petite... Also, everyone there, and I mean everyone is so friendly and pleasant it is a joy to go there.  I wish they were open on Sundays too.  So run, don't walk, and spend lots of money so they are around for a long, long time-or else you'll make me weep.

FF-YDTVhuw_rFPiLum1-eA.text: The first time I walked into Le Petit Chocolat I was a wide-eyed dainty girl. When i left I was a fat woman. This place has the best treats I have ever had. The cinnamon roll... like WHAT IS IN THAT?? It literally melts in your mouth. I get their coffee once, sometimes twice a day. It does not even need extra things like sugar or cream.. its THAT GOOD.  And do not get me started on the pumpkin muffin I had today. I took it down with three swift bites, never looking back.  Ill be in there tomorrow for another coffee, trying to convince myself I do not need another treat but eventually will cave, bc this place is amazing.  Get in there nowww!!

PRyq93hLyIZfupJKo4i3fA.text: This place is amazing! From the cute "French" setting to the delicious treats that are made!!! Amanda, the owner is so friendly! She makes all the pastries and cupcakes fresh EVERY DAY! Which means that she gets there are like 3am to make delicious treats for all of us to eat! The coffee (particularly the Americano's that I've had) is so delightful. My co-workers and I go in here almost every day now for coffee and treats. The cinnamon bun is absolutely delectable!!!! The icing is indescribable! The cupcakes are the best I've ever had and I'm just so obsessed with this place it's not even funny. You NEED to go check it out! This is a public service announcement....GO NOW!!

y4ZB8x92WZIwem_QNqjA2Q.text: The cupcakes deserve six stars! Delicious, moist, and great flavors! My favorite is the berry but my family loves the salted caramel. The cafe... Incredible! The soups are so flavorful and just plan yummy!  The sandwiches are great too! A thumbs up to the lamb! Good flavor combinations.

EYBeJ0xv-z0wh9k2i8iV-g.text: Great little shop run by extremely friendly folk. The homemade pastries and chocolates are fantastic, and the coffee is some of south side's best. Always a good experience coming here

4I4lF4vuVDR6Bvgiz5Bpbw.text: Forget gifts, loved ones, or other vapid excuses to stop into a chocolate shop--my relationship with Le Petit Chocolat is purely and selfishly personal. After a brief hiatus to move into a new space, they've reopened with the usual arsenal of goods (scones, cinnamon buns, cookies, cupcakes, assorted pastries), and have also expanded to include breakfast sandwiches, a lunch panini menu, and homemade soups.  Everything is the best. A sandwich, chips, drink, and cookie cost me eleven dollars. I've found my new home.

Eam27-2RqtrM2pblc0q_JQ.text: If you want the best hot chocolate in town, come to this place. This place is amazing. The freshness of chocolate, the aroma of the shop and the delicacy of the crossiant, it's just out of the world. If you're in town, don't miss this place.

bG2XenDOYQwjHrJDwUMmPg.text: Such a great little place on Carson Street! I walked in and was greeted by the owner, after learning about their business I was thrilled to buy some delicious chocolate and a hot tea and forced myself to not go for the cupcake as well.  They have a great selection, and she mentioned that they are planning to do crepes in the spring - how great is that.... crepes in the spring! Baked goods, hot drinks, chocolate, and adorable valentines day cards all for sale. I highly suggest supporting this small business!

TbXboEX7AX9-dofA3W5hBA.text: Everything I've ever tried here has been incredible. Great breakfast sandwiches, great coffee from La Prima, great cupcakes and cinnamon rolls. The service is always friendly too. Definitely recommend.

CxP9gxdR2mYmfBSfBjRq2Q.text: We were walking along and I spied a large cupcake in the window.  It only took a second of arm-twisting for my boyfriend to convince me to go inside.  We were greeted with a table of ornately decorated chocolates and a case of cupcakes with frosting as big as the cake.  There were also samples of the ginger rose chocolates.  While we sampled, the owner, Amanda, was so nice and talked with us for about 15 minutes about her shop, her plan to introduce more cupcakes, and her chocolates.  Right now, she only has a few cupcake ingredients, but in a week, they're hoping to have a rotating schedule.  She uses real butter cream frosting and each cupcake is filled with a creamy pudding-like filling.  Sadly, I gave up cake for Lent, so I have to come back in a week to taste, but my first will be the peanut butter chocolate.  Or the mango peach.  Or the lemon lavender.  Or....  We did try more chocolates, though.  While we were there, only dark chocolate was available (no complaints here!) although Amanda does offer a selection of white and milk chocolates.  I got the cherry with dark chocolate and le-BF enjoyed a sea salt caramel with dark chocolate.  Amanda uses fair trade cocoa and natural, local ingredients.  They are so rich and satisfying, you only need one.  That's why the French eat like gluttons but are rail-thin - they use quality ingredients without waxes or fillers, so you're satisfied with one..although with all of her flavors, a small sampler box is probably worth it!  Do yourself a favor and stop by.  This is definitely worth a trip to the Southside.  I have a feeling I'll be updating my review to 5 stars after I try the cupcakes (only reason why I didn't give full stars - I can't report on those heavenly-looking cupcakes).

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. All the chocolates!
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemon Lavender Cupcakes

BwZWUF3Z4EuNI5AVpztktA.text: Amazing cupcakes with lovely mousse icing. The salted caramel and peanut butter mousse, both with chocolate cupcakes, were amazing. Light and fluffy, not too heavy and perfect for an afternoon sweet treat.

3LUt_TkgV2etJT91VU74rQ.text: Le petit Chocolat is my favorite place for lunch in the South Side. The sandwiches are delicious. I think they have the best soup in town. When you go, save room for dessert. The cupcakes are fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best breakfast in the South Side!  Spinach, egg, and feta croissant
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted Lamb Panini

-w0jagpI8VvoKGrWtc-sSQ.text: Wednesday was my dad's birthday, and I had decided last minute that I wanted to get him some sort of sweet treat! My husband and I checked out several bakeries on Yelp, but as it was already after 6pm, most of our options were closed.   I was excited to discover that Le Petit Chocolat was still open. I got to the shop and couldn't believe how tiny it was. The shop owner just has one tiny little refrigerated case for cupcakes (probably 40-50 were displayed) and one small counter with display cases for the chocolates (maybe 50-80 displayed here).   I took 4 cupcakes and 4 chocolates to go and brought all the goodies home to my husband and parents. Now, keep in mind that my cooking/baking specialty is cupcakes and that I'm a certified cake decorator. Usually, when I try a cupcake from a shop, I think that I could bake something better. That was not the case here. I tried both the Salted Caramel and Apple cupcakes, and they were out-of-this-world delicious!! The Salted Caramel had the best chocolate cake that I've ever eaten, and trust me, chocolate cake can be tricky to make. It was rich and moist and not at all dry or crumbly, which is how many chocolate cupcakes taste. This cupcake was injected with thick, rich, homemade caramel and topped with an incredible rich and fluffy buttercream and salt. The Apple cupcake was just as delicious. The same incredible buttercream topped off a cupcake that had an interesting shortbread consistency (like nothing I've ever had before) and a dot of apple filling inside.   I'm crossing my fingers that I may stumble upon some leftover goodies today at home but know that I may not be so lucky. I definitely want to go back to this shop sometime very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My first (and definitely not last!) Le Petit Chocolat purchase!

NTfUma1dNKCGdVv0frDpbg.text: Hands down the best place for chocolates, cupcakes, coffee, soup and sandwiches. Super friendly staff , in all honesty probably the nicest people on the planet. Can't stress it enough, this place is AMAZING!!!!

I4yeWNrRYxcdO0rl3U1ocg.text: Most amazing cupcakes in Pittsburgh! The salted caramel is a must try. Truly a hidden gem!

DzOBHRTZ-TTCkF45vfMhTQ.text: There has only been one bakery around Pittsburgh that, in my wildly ignored opinion, has made a cupcake that is 5-star quality (and please, it's not Dozen). Because I'm so used to disappointment, I tend to go into new cupcake experiences with very low expectations.  Especially when it's nearly 10PM and I stop into Le Petit Chocolat for the first time with some friends after a show at the Rex. The cupcakes certainly had The Look -- the frosting was vibrant and smooth with a nice height, and the flavor combinations were a mix of classics and adventurous without being ridiculous.   I bought the Plain Jane and Strawberry Shortcake, even though I wanted to buy them ALL. And after splitting these two with my son when I got home later that night, now I'm sorry that I didn't buy them ALL. These were some damn fine cupcakes, you guys. The frosting was on point and the cake was moist, yet firm---there's such a fine line between "Betty Crocker" and "day old cornbread" when it comes to cupcake texture. I liked that these cupcakes didn't come off as "trying too hard" -- they shine in their simplicity. And considering I bought these 10 minutes before closing time, I imagine that an even fresher batch would bring me to my knees.   I just went to Le Petit's website and saw that my favorite flavor combo is available: lemon lavender. I live way too close to this place. This is about to get dangerous. (And I haven't even tried any of the chocolate yet!)

zrdGDr9wJyFsL3G8crD0ZA.text: Solid 4 stars for their cupcakes!  I tried the lemon lavender cupcake which was a vanilla cupcake with lemon curd filling and lavender frosting.  The filling and frosting were incredible!  They went really well together - the tartness of the lemon filling with the floral/sweetness of the frosting balanced each other out.    The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars was because of the cake part of the cupcake.  It was a bit dry and wouldn't stand alone very well without the deliciousness of the filling and frosting.

pNz-OzJe9aksF0ybShG6TA.text: I started a new position at a place on East Carson Street. By my second day of work everybody said I had to try this place.   I went in for coffee, which is warm, delicious, and perfectly made. I usually get Lattes. And at a fantastic price! Rumor has it she has yogurts, amazing cupcakes, and lemonade...her reputation certainly precedes her ;)   I've tried muffins, cinnamon rolls, chocolates, lattes and tea....and I keep going back. I'm so happy to enjoy this little slice of happiness before every shift.

SwrvJRxHkDHpv3IMwJbVcg.text: This place packed the cupcakes, and gave it to me like this. She even told me that the packaging was weird. And i shouldve known something was weird! The cupcakes were out of the holes and on each other like someone shook it!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It was much worse when i opened it up

Gxx49Akhx4D8kdskHV8LlQ.text: Can't stay away!!... We stopped into Le Petit Chocolat on a whim one day and thank goodness we did. Amanda & her husband own this awesome bakery & cafe. We've only had the cupcakes and chocolates but we buy multiples of each when we stop - they're that good!! The lemon & orange, Very Jane, and chocolate with marshmallow are our favorite cupcakes. The cannelle orange chocolates are seriously heaven!!... Try one! Or two or three!... We tried one with ginger & dark chocolate - something special about that combination! You seriously can't go wrong with anything here!!

ijb0UTnYtukEOQ649JcJ7g.text: Delicious chocolate croissant, great hot chocolate! the staff was very friendly and helpful.

28v7MjsGY2XxVe2x2VFRpg.text: Spectacular soup in a gorgeous place! Great chocolates, espresso, baked goods, sandwiches, and the staff is lovely.

f-aHWIMZEOMktd7QxPuCWA.text: This place is a lovely gem. I love coming here for breakfast sandwiches. Amanda and her husband start baking at 4 am. The owners are very sweet and welcoming.

7n5B5mslUTGulFnbDeOODg.text: Loved this charming cafe in Southside!  I only stopped by for a little while, but the hot chocolate was delicious. There was plenty of seating to choose from. The two little window alcoves seem like great places to sit and people watch if you have some time to spare.

n6B_V0lqAtnOsIM6XiWvBQ.text: Best chocolates, soups, cupcakes, cookies, and service.  Thank you for being on east Carson street, see you soon!

jKsIrxxd0xaXuw6AEDvZyQ.text: When it comes to "gourmet cupcakes," definitely consider trying Le Petit Chocolat. I visited this cute little store along Carson Street right after lunch and was pleasantly surprised!   A few people were in there eating sandwiches (they looked yummy!), while I waited patiently to order.  For 3 dollars (a single cupcake) it's on the pricey side, but less than specialty cupcakes you buy in NYC or Philadelphia.   I tried the Strawberry Shortcake cupcake. Strawberry buttercream, vanilla cake, AND a strawberry filling. The cake was moist, crumbly and not too sweet!   The baker also carefully packaged the cake in a window pastry box, giving it a nice presentation.   Next time I would like to try their chocolates though! The case was empty when I visited around 1 in the afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry filled cupcake!! Delicious!
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Case of cupcakes

xdeqW0FLC-0-sQdxNc0c-w.text: I bought cupcakes here for my friend's birthday -  they were fresh and the presentation was amazing. My friend really enjoyed the chocolate peanut butter flavor. The inside of the store is cute and quaint; I would definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed berry
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate peanut butter
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Double chocolate

AK_HspJzb-7YMV83vv2rMA.text: Cute place! This cute cafe has some delicious cupcakes! We ordered salted caramel chocolate cupcake and it was divine. I'm very picky about cupcakes, and these were moist and light! The frosting was light and creamy! Caramel filled :) Will definitely be back when I need to satisfy the cupcake craving !

zaLFxBEGE9vg1XL-J7jWkw.text: Why didn't I go in here first when I parked in Southside? Wow, I didn't know this place served lunch in addition to chocolate! You can order paninis and other sandwiches as well as chocolate flavored drinks. They also have candy for sale. On a shelf they serve all types of delectable goodies. As far as pastry is concerned you are not limited to chocolate. They have a nice variety of cupcakes, scones, cookies, and different types of pastries. Still reeling from my lunch I opted for their chocolate chip cookie and a cranberry scone to take home with me.  They served me my cookie on a china dish and gave me a bag for my scone. The place is neatly laid out and they have a few tables you can sit at. The cookie was fluffy and moist. I really enjoyed eating every bite of it. I learned also they sell chocolate chip scones but will try the cranberry one for breakfast tomorrow. They only had two types of cupcakes left when I was there. One was chocolate with a caramel drizzle icing and the other red velvet. They sell for $3.00 each. Next time I will indulge in one of these.  Prices are very reasonable for lunch which warrants a return visit from me to try out one of their sandwiches as well as dessert! Can't wait to come back here. It is located near a pay parking lot which is city metered near the Birmingham bridge.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemon with cream cheese
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Death by chocolate!
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cranberry scone

1-gN3oDNmRxi2kpHiVWzcw.text: I always like to stop here for a treat before heading home. Trying to keep weight in check I grab something to split with my boyfriend. Usually a pastry that we can have for dessert. They have a nice selection of cookies and danishes as well as cupcakes. The vanilla bean custard happens to top my list of yum.  I've been here several times and have had various cupcakes and things. Coffees are always brewed to perfection. Such a cozy place to duck in on a cold and dreary day or even in a lovely sunny day.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla bean custard cupcake.
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior.
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Counter.

929y3GKpRSILGuOZK8Tcjw.text: AWESOME!  I had cupcakes delivered to my daughter at Carnegie Mellon School of theatre and they were absolutely wonderful. Thank you so much for making her birthday extra special

3FPeDKW6hdposZP7TvfruQ.text: I recently was gifted a cupcake from here and based on that, I definitely plan to check out the shop! It was a beautiful chocolate strawberry cupcake that was sooo very good!  The cupcake itself was spongy and chocolatey filled with strawberry filling. Topped with a great whipped strawberry icing and a half of fresh strawberry on top was delicious! I'll update with more when I stop in to the shop to check out what else they have to offer.

aGHCcC8H2AoM8ouSIvcegw.text: Stumbled on this adorable spot wandering around Southside.  Best cappuccino I've had since getting back from Italy.  Food was great as well and the owner is delightful.  So much pride in what she does and it shows.

Kj5Z6twy3BCpAbytWjWYQA.text: Le Petit Chocolat Cafe   Friday, February 9, 2018 10:59 AM  I love this bakery.  Their cupcakes are absolutely fantastic - perhaps even the best in the city.  But product availability can be incredibly frustrating and inconsistent.  On three separate occasions, I've stopped in at 10:00 or 10:30 am to grab cupcakes on my way to a meeting, and to my surprise, they've had zero cupcakes available for purchase.  (Unfortunately, it happened again today).  I understand that she makes cupcakes fresh each day - that's one of the things that makes them so good - but if a business opens at 9:00 am, customers expect product to be available at 9:00 am.  It would be unfair of me to complain with out attempting to be constructive. With that in mind, I'd like to offer the following ideas/suggestions: * Perhaps she can start the baking process earlier, so that product is available when the business opens. * Maybe she can consider baking tomorrow morning's inventory the night before. * She could clearly set the expectation that cupcakes will not be available until a specified time, while all other goods are available for purchase starting at 8:30 or 9:00 am.  Or, if product won't be available until 11:00, then perhaps they shouldn't open until 11:00 am.

6s0wUZyGua2_Ii7bAup4nQ.text: Omg! I just finished the most DELICIOUS cupcake I have EVER eaten in my life!   It was a salted caramel chocolate cupcake with the lightest, tastiest icing I have ever tasted! Oh my taste buds are SO happy!   I could eat a dozen of these heavenly delights!   The handmade chocolates are to die for! I think I will ask for a dozen for my birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Please try this heavenly shoppe!

MqnBSiJEvxXcucKwNkmxnQ.text: Delicious cupcakes & Fast Delivery! The perfect way to show some birthday love. Abraham was very friendly and careful to make sure the cupcakes I order arrived to the right address. My Auntie was thrilled!!

9haKU4mkqu4Wmay-XAXL6Q.text: Wow, what a great little cupcake they serve. I had the chocolate and berry cupcake. The filling is fantastic and compliments the rest of it nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bYk1zdMaw_rJaTcXZ1Vycg.text: Amanda, the one owner (her Senegal-born husband is the other), is absolutely perfect for this career. She is warm, friendly,  knowledgeable, and genuinely committed to making sure each customer leaves happy. Count me in.  She patiently explained about all their goodies, drinks, etc.  My first was the Cerise truffle. It was absolutely scrumptious to this nonchocoholic. The ONLY reason I didn't have another, was I calculated how many hours of figure skating it would take me to offset 1 truffle. At only 5'2", I have to reign myself in. No one wants to see a jigglefest on the ice.  The truffle was a rich, decadent, moist , with a perfect balance of cherry taste. The cute decorative top was artwork defined.  I ordered a currant scone. I had a couple bites, and saved the rest for Daughter.  Grudgingly. Currants aren't something you often see, so I wasn't passing this up. The scone was just as scones should be, with a generous helping of currants. Perfectly  baked.  I told Amanda to surprise me with coffee, just make it half decaffeinated. I got Sumatra, one of my favorites. It was perfect with the scone.  I took a orange citrus cupcake to go. Amanda's husband called her to frost them after he was done baking them. Totally worth the wait. I again, shared with Daughter. Grudgingly. The texture was coarser than Graham's Bakery cupcakes. This was a tiny bit drier, a bit crumbly, and delicious. Delicate, faintly sweet, orange flavor. Complemented nicely with white tea.  I will be back, chocoholic Daughter in tow. Grudgingly.

UBmnpbDaahPm_535PH6gqA.text: DO YOU LIKE CHOCOLATE? THEN GET HERE, STAT!  I'm not messing around. I had one bite of their pistachio chocolate and I thought I had died and gone to truffle heaven. Seriously, I'm not joking. I'm not even a choco-holic. Don't get me wrong, I like chocolate, but I'm not obsessed like others are. If you're obsessed you will die and go to chocolate heaven here!  Pick from an array of different fancy pants french chocolates, or try out their new cupcakes. At $3 a pop, they're not cheap, but look like a decent size compared to other unnamed cupcake shops around 'tahn. Plus, the icing is light and fluffy and so is the cake. Just the way I like it. I tried the strawberry cupcake, which had homemade strawberry filling. Deeelicious.   The outside looks totally unassuming, and I had mistakenly thought it was a new business, but came to find out they've been open for about a year! So don't just walk by next time, stop in! And you can thank me later.... with a peice of chocolate!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dark cherry chocolate

7FQ99NiZD7QN5Oh6O_pUOA.text: I was happy to stop by Le Petit Chocolat on a Sunday afternoon with a few other Yelpers and friends to meet the owner Amanda and enjoy some tasty treats.  As always, I was not disappointed.    Amanda clearly knew how to win the hearts of Yelpers - sweets and alcohol!  We were offered chocolate fondue, mini cupcakes, chocolates and cupcakes we could fill and design ourselves with a variety of options.  She also provided fruity refreshments that of course tasted better with a little champagne.    In between sweet bites and fruity sips, Amanda told us how she and her husband have expanded their business.  It started with chocolates then moved on to cupcakes.  Now they've added coffee and espresso.  And always offering quality products.  A few pastries are also in the works and there was talk of discounts when purchasing quantities - potentially even preferred customer discounts!  She's game for any kind of special requests if she can pull it off and welcomes private parties with chocolate fondue or cupcake decorating.  Her enthusiasm is impressive as is her success.  Maybe one has led to the other?  My friend ordered a sampling of the cupcakes on our way out.  And because "it's the end of the day," Amanda threw a few extra cupcakes into her box.  What a sweet ending to our visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BFF cupcakes
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cupcake decorating
Photo of Le Petit Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

R0hTK2Gh8n_AzKdh9AOwsQ.text: Love this French cafe !!! Best breakfast sandwiches. everything there is delicious.  Coffee from la prima a plus .

NLGWIzS5PBtIFey5f6i9PA.text: Its been a while since I reviewed this gem and it's past due with the new location! This place is out of this world. Savory? Sweet? How about all of the above. Amanda and her family deliver on it all! The cupcakes are filled and delicious. The chocolates have converted me. I will never eat regular chocolate again! (Welll lets not make promises here we cant keep) but seriously the chocolate is unlike any I've ever had! The soups and sandwiches are amazing. Never had a bad thing. My favorite soup was the African Chicken soup uhhhh-mazing! Sandwich of choice either the spinach,egg&cheese on a croissant or the gourmet grilled cheese are so good! Coffee is perfect. Just everything about it is top notch. If you are a southsider and never stopped here do yourself a favor and give it a shot. I promise you wont be disappointed.

VYVCvBcDx93_JGWjNTVg8A.text: We came here last spring for the first time to try their chocolates which are honestly amazing. They are perfect delicacies with great flavor. You can tell there is an immense amount of love, care, and attention paid to detail. This has carried through into the reopening of La Petit as a cafe now with breakfast sandwiches and panini now.  This truly is a family cafe, everyone is friendly and the atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. We tried the Caprese breakfast sandwich this time on English muffins and it was delicious. I will Definitely be back, this is a local favorite of mine that I definitely want to see succeed in south side!
